Html:
Thank you an congratulations! This tool is very useful!

I have some doubts about ABNT style.

First: When I cite more than one page, the ABNT Style shows, for example: "(COELHO, 2010, p. 10-13)". Accord to ABNT, this should be: ""(COELHO, 2010, pp. 10-13)". How can I put other "p"?

Second: In the bibliography, when I have more than one book with the same author, ABNT tells to replace the author name in the second (third an so on) citation by "______." Can I do that with ABNT style?

Regards,

Look for %Pages:p. :p. % and change it into %Pages:p. :pp. %

Basically, whatever is after the first ':' is the prefix for a single page and whatever is after the second ':' is the prefix for multiple pages.
